references.paper_title: AMP: Adversarial motion priors for stylized physics-based character control
references.reason: This paper introduces the Adversarial Motion Prior (AMP) framework, which is the foundation for the teacher policy learning in HumanVLA.
This seminal paper introduces Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning (GAIL), a technique leveraged in HumanVLA for learning realistic motion generation.
This paper introduces behavioral cloning, a crucial technique used in HumanVLA for knowledge distillation from a state-based teacher to a vision-language-action student model.
This paper directly tackles the problem of physical human-scene interaction (HSI) synthesis, a related area to the HumanVLA's focus on object rearrangement tasks.

references.paper_title: Efficient learning on point clouds with basis point sets
references.reason: This paper introduces the Basis Point Set (BPS) encoding technique that is adopted by HumanVLA to encode object geometry efficiently for the teacher policy.
